intro: Dombeya wittei, commonly known as the white dombeya, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters. The plant produces showy, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in terminal inflorescences. These flowers bloom in late winter to early spring, attracting pollinators such as birds and insects. The leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a slightly hairy texture.
